Detailed Description

Reports a "logic error".

Includes file and line number. This exception type should only be used in cases which fail due to programming logic errors which should be preventable and cannot be handled with simple assert() statements.

Member Function Documentation

◆ addExtraInfo()

void addExtraInfo ( const std::string &  name,
const T &  value 
)
inlineinherited

Adds a (name, value) pair as an additional piece of information for the error.

The name and value pair will be printed on an individual line after the error type and before the error message. The extra info lines are printed in the order they were added to the Error object.

Parameters
nameThe name of the extra piece of info.
valueThe value of the extra piece of info (must be convertible to a std::string using std::stringstream).

Definition at line 285 of file Errors.h.

◆ what()

virtual const char* what ( ) const
throw (
)
inlinevirtualinherited

Creates a formatted error message.

The message is formatted as

M++ error: <type>.
<name>: <value>
<message>

where <type> and <message> correspond to the arguments in the constructor and the optional (name, value) lines correspond to extra information provided by addExtraInfo() or operator().
